formula: E.g.f.: exp(-1/4*LambertW(-4*x))a(n) = A016813(n)^A023443(n). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Dec 03 2013From _Peter Bala_, Dec 19 2013: (Start)The e.g.f. A(x) = 1 + x + 9*x^2/2! + 169*x^3/3! + 4913*x^4/4! + ... satisfies:1) A(x*exp(-4*x)) = exp(x) = 1/A(-x*exp(4*x));2) A^4(x) = 1/x*series reversion(x*exp(-4*x));3) A(x^4) = 1/x*series reversion(x*exp(-x^4));4) A(x) = exp(x*A(x)^4);5) A(x) = 1/A(-x*A(x)^8). (End)E.g.f.: (-LambertW(-4*x)/(4*x))^(1/4). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Dec 07 2014
